list: Individual Deductible - what you must pay before insurance start covering you
Family Deductible - what you must pay for you family before insurance start covering; number of family members doesnâ€™t matter
Coinsurance - the percentage that you pay on the price that goes over the deductible
Out of pocket Maximum - the absolute maximum you will ever pay (ex: 8000)
Doctor Visits - there is a copay you must pay each time you go to the doctor
Inpatient - if you are living in a hospital, you must pay this percentage of the cost
Outpatient - when you go in and out of a hospital, you must pay a copay
Emergency Room Visits - a relatively high copay you pay for going to the ER (ex: 150 + 20% coinsurance)
Out of Network - insurances only cover certain networks of doctors, and if you visit someone else, it costs more

list: The first number is the copay for Generic Drugs
The second number is the copay for Preferred Drugs
The third number is the copay for Branded Drugs
Prescription Drug Deductible (separate) - $100/person means you have to pay 100 in a year before the cost of your drugs is limited to copay amounts
Life Plan - the amount your family will receive if you die of a natural death
Accidental Death or Dismemberment - dying in some sort of accident will lead to your family receiving this much
Tobacco Premium - you must pay a higher premium if you smoke
Short term disability - after 14 days, if you are still sick, then you can be paid at 50-60% of your salary
Long term disability - after 6 months, if you are still sick, then you can be paid at 50-60% of your salary
